activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12003
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad this would be my approach can you assign me this issue 

solution:      
updating the handleMarkAsComplete function in EncounterActions.tsx to ensure that when an encounter is marked as completed, the period.end field is set to the current date and time (if it is not already set). This guarantees that the end date will be accurately reflected for completed encounters, resolving the issue where it previously displayed as "ongoing.

- When marking an encounter as completed, the end date is now set to the current timestamp if it was not already present.
 
END DATE : TODAY

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11669
activity.text:
> [@gobardan1707](https://github.com/gobardan1707) can you please explain this how you solved this?

so what happens is when you try print the details in the printquestinnaireresponce  part it only considering a single div with username and logo , it is not able to identify the encounter details and the responcecard so what i have identified that the problem was  in the printpreview part the overflow is hidden thats why  the  other things were not readable you can check it out 

i have solved the issue what i did is  i have changed the overflow hidden to overflow visible after that the print is working fine at everyplace and i have done few little more changes let me know if you want to know more

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11692
activity.text:
Hi @sunidhisachan can you please assign me this issue i can solve this 
SOLUTION :  1 . modify the registration form so that the state input comes before the pincode for validation
2. Frontend Validation: Using an NPM package to verify the pincode against the state in real-time.
3. Backend Validation: Ensure that the backend also checks if the pincode belongs to the state before saving patient details.
4. at last error handling 

END DATE : 5th april
